title: Latest round of layoffs at Alphabet targets YouTube: report
text:
YouTube is shaving an unspecified number of jobs, according to multiple reports, the latest sign of belt-tightening at Google parent Alphabet Inc. 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
GOOG,
        +0.21%.
       According to The Verge, Alphabet Chief Business Officer Mary Ellen Coe made the announcement Wednesday in an internal memo. Last week, more than 1,000 people were laid off from Alphabet. Gold has generally outpaced performance in silver over the last few years, but the tide may soon turn in favor of silver. Jon Swartz is a senior reporter for MarketWatch in San Francisco, covering many of the biggest players in tech, including Netflix, Facebook and Google. Jon has covered technology for more than 20 years, and previously worked for Barron's and USA Today. Follow him on Twitter @jswartz.
